meanings.definition: Transfer (something) again to a different place or person.
meanings.sent1: She retransfers the books to the library every month.
meanings.sent2: He always retransfers the files to his colleagues for review.
meanings.sent3: The cat retransfers the toy mouse to its owner as a playful gesture.
meanings.sent4: The wind retransfers the fallen leaves across the yard.
meanings.sent5: The teacher retransfers knowledge to her students through engaging activities.

meanings.definition: The action of transferring something again to a different place or person.
meanings.sent1: The retransfers of the documents were completed by the end of the day.
meanings.sent2: She keeps a log of all the retransfers made within the department.
meanings.sent3: The retransfers of the cookies from the jar to the plate amused the children.
meanings.sent4: The retransfers of power within the organization led to chaos.
meanings.sent5: The constant retransfers of ownership confused the neighbors.
